title: Implement hive status with multiple workers
description: Show all active workers, their current tasks, worktrees, and progress. Display blocked tasks and what's blocking them. Show overall task counts (done/active/blocked).

title: Implement hive merge workflow
description: hive merge <worker> command for manual merge resolution. Handle conflicts: preserve worktree, human resolves, then hive cleanup. Support hive sync for push/pull all branches.

title: Implement minimal daemon (hived)
description: Background daemon: poll for stuck workers (no activity for stuck_threshold), report status when queried, optional desktop notifications on failure. Commands: hived start/stop/status.

title: Phase 2: Beads Integration - Full task lifecycle
description: Full Beads integration: task commands, atomic claims, dependency tracking, too-big workflow, and discovered work support.

title: Implement CLAUDE.md context generation
description: Generate per-task CLAUDE.md with: task ID, title, description, acceptance criteria, worker instructions (how to signal done/too_big/blocked), and project context from .hive/plan.md.

title: Implement conflict detection (module-based)
description: Track module field in Beads tasks. Warn during planning if parallel tasks touch same module. Add --parallel-safe flag to tasks. Mark conflicting tasks with blocked-by.

title: Phase 3: Parallel Execution - Safe multi-worker support
description: Parallel execution support: multiple workers, conflict detection, worker coordination, and multi-worker status.

title: Implement discovered work support
description: Agent can run bd create 'description' --discovered-from <task_id> to file work found during execution. Links back to parent task. Creates new planned tasks without blocking current work.

title: Implement error handling and recovery
description: Handle all failure modes: spawn failures, timeouts, crashes, merge conflicts. Preserve worktrees for inspection when needed. Clear error messages with actionable notes in Beads.

title: Implement hive work --parallel N
description: Spawn N independent ralph loops, each picking unassigned/unblocked tasks. Uses atomic claims to prevent double-assignment. Hard limit from config max_workers.

title: Implement worktree create/cleanup
description: Create unique worktrees: worktrees/<worker-id>-<task-id>/ with branch task-<task-id> from main. Cleanup: git worktree remove, git branch -D. Handle stale worktrees from crashes.

title: Implement hive work command (serial)
description: Run the Ralph loop for single worker: claim task from Beads, create worktree, generate CLAUDE.md, spawn agent in tmux, poll for completion, handle outcomes (done/too_big/blocked/failed), merge if done, cleanup.
close_reason: Implemented hive work command with serial Ralph loop execution, including task claiming, worktree management, agent spawning in tmux, and completion polling with comprehensive tests

title: Implement dependency tracking integration
description: Wire up Beads blocked-by relationships: bd ready only returns tasks with all dependencies done AND merged. Update task selection logic to respect dependencies.
close_reason: Implemented dependency tracking - tasks with open/in_progress dependencies are now skipped

title: Implement worker coordination via atomic claims
description: Multiple workers race for tasks: if bd update fails (task already in_progress), worker retries with next task. No lock files, just Beads state as coordination layer.

title: Implement atomic claim semantics
description: Ensure task can only transition planned→in_progress exactly once. Either bd update fails if not planned, or implement bd claim <task_id> --worker <id> with compare-and-swap. Critical for parallel correctness.
close_reason: Implemented atomic claim semantics using bd update --claim flag

title: Implement hive task commands
description: Thin wrappers around bd: hive task list (bd list), hive task show <id> (bd show), hive task add 'description' (bd create for discovered work).

title: Implement hive init command
description: Setup .hive/ directory structure with config.toml, workers.json, and plan.md. Verify beads is initialized. Create worktrees/ directory.

title: Review: Evaluate task command wrapper vs direct Beads usage
description:
Review whether the hive task command wrappers (hive task list/show/add) add sufficient value, or if users should use Beads (bd) commands directly.

## Questions to consider:
1. Does wrapping bd commands in hive task add meaningful value?
2. Is the abstraction worth the maintenance overhead?
3. Would users benefit from learning bd directly instead?
4. Are there hive-specific enhancements we could add to justify the wrapper?
5. Does it create confusion having two ways to do the same thing?

## Current implementation:
- hive task list → bd list
- hive task show <id> → bd show <id>
- hive task add 'desc' → bd create (with discovered work note)

## Possible outcomes:
- Keep as-is: Wrappers provide value through consistent hive CLI
- Remove wrappers: Users should use bd directly
- Enhance wrappers: Add hive-specific features to justify abstraction
- Hybrid: Keep some commands, remove others

This review should be done after other core features are complete.

title: Phase 1: Core - Basic planning and serial execution
description: Core functionality for Hive orchestrator: setup, planning, serial execution, context generation, worktree management, and spawn failure detection.

title: Phase 4: Polish - Production ready
description: Production polish: minimal daemon, merge workflow, error handling, recovery, and documentation.

title: Implement spawn failure detection
description: Grace period check (default 30s): if no tmux pane output AND no Beads state change, mark task failed with reason agent_spawn_failed. Prevents tasks stuck in in_progress indefinitely.

title: Implement too_big workflow
description: When agent runs bd update <id> --status too_big, ralph loop detects this, cleans up worktree, and human decomposes via hive plan --continue. Add hive task too-big <id> command.

title: Write Hive documentation
description: README with quick start, CLI reference, configuration guide. Document task states, ralph loop, merge policy, parallelization rules. Add examples for common workflows.

title: Test discovered task
notes: Created via hive task add (discovered work)
close_reason: Test task for hive task add command

title: Implement hive plan command
description: Interactive planning session: spawn Claude agent, human provides goal/constraints, agent asks clarifying questions, proposes breakdown, human reviews, agent creates Beads tasks with dependencies. Supports --approve and --show flags.
